headline: CSX, BNSF Pact Sparks Debate on Whether Another Rail Merger Is Approaching
summary: A partnership between  CSX  and BNSF Railway to connect the east and west coasts sparked a debate as to whether the two railroad operators are testing a merger or actually trying to avoid a full-on consolidation.  The railroad operators said Friday they have teamed to launch three new intermodal services.  One will link Southern California to Charlotte, N.C., and Jacksonville, Fla. A second will connect Phoenix to Atlanta.

headline: CSX and Warren Buffett’s BNSF Made News. Why Investors Are Disappointed.
summary: CSX  and Burlington Northern Santa Fe announced a partnership on Friday, sending shares of CSX falling while the market roared higher.  Investors were hoping for more.  The  and  rose 1.5% and 1.9%, respectively, after Fed Chair Jerome Powell’s Jackson Hole speech, which the market interpreted as paving the way for a September interest rate cut.

headline: BNSF and CSX announce new joint domestic and international intermodal service
summary: BNSF Railway and CSX said they will partner on seamless coast-to-coast rail service, just weeks after Union Pacific and Norfolk Southern proposed their own transcontinental merger. The post BNSF and CSX announce new joint domestic and international intermodal service appeared first on FreightWaves.

headline: BNSF, CSX launch new US coast-to-coast linking to boost freight services
summary: The new routes will link Southern California with Charlotte, North Carolina, and Jacksonville, Florida.  The move comes after reports emerged last month of a potential deal between the two railroad operators that would counter a rival transcontinental merger between Union Pacific and Norfolk Southern.  Union Pacific launched a similar domestic intermodal service earlier this month, connecting Southern California's Inland Empire with the Chicago area.

headline: Lutnick backs Union Pacific-Norfolk Southern rail merger
summary: U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick backed Union Pacific’s proposed $72 billion takeover of Norfolk Southern, saying it will create more efficient transcontinental rail freight transportation. The post Lutnick backs Union Pacific-Norfolk Southern rail merger appeared first on FreightWaves.
